question: Oh yah-sure, I know what some of your big city, no bra wearin', hairy-legged women's libbers say, "Pageants are old- fashioned" and, uh, and "demeaning" to the girls --
answer: What's sick is women dressin' like men!

question: Uh... You betcha, Iris. Yah-I think yous boys'll find that things are different here in Mount Rose...
answer: A.k.a. Minneapolis - St. Paul.

question: ...Today's "To Do" list includes a trip to the Mall of America. We need outfits for the "Physical Fitness" number --
answer: Nothin' too showy!

question: Y'betcha, Iris. We still need a third judge and we need to think of a theme.
answer: Gladys -- Gladys! Look out!

question: Oh, my! Hello, Father Donigan! Sidewalks, sidewalks?
answer: That's why we Lutherans use grape Koolaid for the blood of Christ. Oh, there's a parking space over there. Oh, no, that's just a compact. Sorry.

question: You'd think they'd build the parking lot of America to go with the Mall of America!
answer: It's a two-hundred dollar fine!

question: I said I'd move if a cripple came. Let's just run in the store and pick out some outfits.
answer: All right, let's go.

question: Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait! I just thought of the theme.
answer: Oh! What is it?

question: So what was the theme of the pageant last year?
answer: Last year? It was, "Buy American."

question: And the year before that?
answer: "U.S.A. is A-okay."

question: Can you remember the theme of your favorite pageant?
answer: "Can I? I'm Amer-I-Can!" People ask me where I get this. I don't know, it's...maybe a gift from God or somethin'.

question: ... So we adopt Molly three year ago when we come to America, to help acclimate us to American.
answer: To America, Dad. Oh, Mom...

question: English! English, you stupid little retard! We America now, Tina! Tina! Tina!! TINA!!! AHHHHHH! No! We not like to hear it! Go to your room and shut up! What, you deaf? I say shut up-shut up- SHUT UP! Cut her outta this! Now Molly, tell movie man what you talent do.
answer: I'll be line dancin'.

question: Well, you know, I think everyone's doing really well considering the fact that she was so young.
answer: It's always hard to see the young ones called home, especially on an exploding thresher. It's just so odd and gross.

question: You know that sometimes it's hard to understand God's great plan.
answer: Yeah.

question: But the show must go on. I gotta get a hold of Ted and ask him if we can use that barn light as a spot again. So you watch the Jell-o salad, okay?
answer: All right. Okay.

question: ...Oh, yeah-right. I ain't gonna be in no goddamn pageant! Look what happened to that dork-ass farm girl.
answer: Tammy Curry?

question: Yah-yah. Everyone says this is a big accident? She got iced because she wins everything, and this time someone didn't want her to win.
answer: This pageant's like a roach motel.

question: Girls check in, but they don't check out.
answer: Yeah. And they say smokin' is bad for your health.

question: My winning...the Mount Rose... ...American Teen Princess Pageant... ...Amber does my hair...once a week.
answer: Well...it's the least I can do for the reigning Mount Rose Junior Miss Amer--

question: What?
answer: Huh? Oh...Uh, just a little snarl... There we go.

question: Beautiful... Maybe next week... a perm.
answer: Yah... sure...

question: ... Dreams? Yah-sure I got kem... Sometimes I dream of winnin'... I dream of gettin' outta Mount Rose and bein' a big time reporter like Diane Sawyer. I mean, guys get outta Mount Rose all the time for hockey scholarships or prison. But the pageant's kinda my only chance. ... Yah-1963. Her beauty worked against her when she started as a reporter in Louisville, her hometown. Those were different times.
answer: Hey, Amber, y'get my smokes?

question: That's my mom. I'll get kem in a sec.
answer: Oh shit!

question: They're from L.A. They wanted to see my room and film me for their movie.
answer: Oh... How quickly they grow up. Hey, if they ask you to take off your shirt, get the money first.

question: ...You betcha. S'posed to be colder-n- a witches tit tonight...
answer: Oh, Lester. He loves his weather, y'know.

question: Hey, ya like it? Open it...Yah-the globe. Pull at the equator there.
answer: We're not in the showroom, Dear.

question: That's enough, young lady.
answer: "Impartial?" Outside this house I'm Gladys Leeman, President, Civil Servettes - impartial as the day is long. But we're inside my home now and I've gotta warn you, I'm wearin' my "wife apron" and "mom hat." So, I can safely say that I'm the mother of the most talented contestant Mount Rose has ever seen. I'll field that one - Rebecca's saving her voice.

question: Yah-she's damn near as good as that little black fella - with the glass eye.
answer: Sammy Davis, Jr., honey.

question: ...Nope. Never judged nothin' afore --
answer: Are we on "Cops?" Are we on "Cops?" Are we on "Cops?"

question: Shut up, Hank. This here's business.
answer: Ow, Harold - Mom said not the head.

question: Well, Mom's dead, so shut your fly trap.
answer: I will if you shut your piehole.

question: Here, I'll take it. It's my job. Well, you're supposed to put it in the... Then it must be Wednesday.
answer: So, uh, I-I'm not really busy Friday. I just said that - y'know.

question: I know.
answer: So if, uh, you wanted to do somethin'...

question: AMBER/BRETT Huntin' season.
answer: Well, uh, I'm cuttin' out early today to do a little duck huntin'...but, uh, maybe I could call you tonight.

question: Yah-sure, fine...fine.
answer: Okay...well, bye.

question: What do you mean, they take out her butt?
answer: Oh, Jesus H. Christ!

question: Are we on "Cops" again?
answer: You could be quiet.

question: Hi.
answer: Hi. It's just the guys that are...you know, makin' the movie about the pageant. I told you about kem.

question: Oh, naw. Hi.
answer: This here's Loretta.

question: No. You just missed her. Amber got called in to the bone gardens tonight. You just missed her. She's in a helluva mood today, anyways.
answer: Say, yous boys been to the Leeman's?

question: Loretta, shut it.
answer: Y'know, if you have, you got all the pictures of the winner you need.

question: Shut it up, Loretta.
answer: Oh, Christ, it's true. Let's just say who should win, who deserves to win is Amber.

question: Why don't you paint a big red target on your ass, Loretta.
answer: She's the prettiest, y'know. The best damn tapper. The most smartest...

question: "Most smartest?" Oh, that's good, Loretta. Make sure you get a picture of that. "Most smartest." We're cuttin you off and sendin' you home.
answer: Well, excuse me, Annette, but I'm braggin' up your kid, here. Amber's gonna be the next Diane Sawyer, y'know...

question: I'll be right back. See ya later.
answer: All right, they're makin' a movie.

question: You don't know where this is gonna...
answer: I got a hairdo.

question: Why do I think Becky'll win? You're talkin'... Don't pinch!. You're talkin' kbout the richest family in a small town. It's front page news when one of kem takes a shit. Can one of yous boys give me a ride home?
answer: Don't fall for it. She lives two trailers down.

question: So? Be real easy.
answer: Go on home, Loretta. Come on. Go on, the party's over.

question: -- red nose and ears. I know, I know.
answer: An obviously upset Amber puts make-up on Brett.

question: Sorry I couldn't talk today kcause...I'm scared, okay? I open my locker right after first period and there's a picture of Tammy Curry taped inside.
answer: Amber holds up a snapshot of a SMILING GIRL on a

question: This was written on back.
answer: A visibly upset Amber still applies make-up to Brett.

question: Yah-sure, Tammy liked to driver her dad's thresher - she said the heavy vibration helped her think, y'know? But I know for a fact she only smoked after a good drive. You ask me or anyone else who isn't scared to talk about it - Tammy was murdered. God, I bet Diane Sawyer never had to deal with crap like this... Toss me "Caucasian #5," would ya?
answer: Amber...

question: No, don't say it. Another stray bullet to the head.
answer: You hafta go home. There's some kinda emergency at the trailer park.

question: Relax, that's my ma's code for, "Bring home milk and a carton-a Luckys."
answer: No. Loretta called. There's been a... a fire.

question: Oh my God - no! Is my mom okay? Was she home?
answer: No, she's just screamin' "Mom, Mom!" kcause she's got Tourettes... She's Annette's kid, dipshit.

question: Is Mom okay?
answer: She's alive, sweetie.

question: Where is she?!
answer: She's right over there.

question: Mommmm! I'll be right behind you in the hearse!
answer: Don't let that worry you, Annette!

question: Annette, why don't you just see if there's any beer left in that can and relax a bit. You're what?!
answer: I-I'm quittin' the pageant.

question: I heard you, I was just tryin' to scare you into changin' your mind. Oh for Chrissakes, Amber, the woman clung to your tap shoes while flyin' through the air like a Goddamn lawn dart!
answer: Oh God, I'm dead...

question: D'ya think a nice cool mint'd help if I shoved your head up your ass?
answer: So, what do I say?

question: Simple. Just say, "Mom, I know you sacrificed everything - relationships, dreams - your tummy, ass and thighs - all to bring me into this world. All so I could have tap lessons and be in the pageant - the same one you were in. But, y'know what? I'm quittin'." There. Easy as pie.
answer: Oh my God. I'm so dead...

question: Go on! Get out!
answer: Mom, look, don't say anything. First of all, I'm not pregnant.

question: I ain't lettin' go ktil you tell me what's up. I'm reaching' a point where I'd kill someone for the nicotine on their fingernails.
answer: Okay. Yesterday I...I got this picture. So I kinda, y'know, I'm thinkin' no. I'm gonna, I-I-I'm gonna quit the pageant.

question: What?!
answer: Ow!

question: Would yous boys excuse us a second? Loretta, you too.
answer: Nice mouth you got there, Mom, but I- I'm not goin' through this again.

question: You're not goin' through this again? You? You're not the one who knows how Jiffy Pop feels.
answer: Oh, c'mon... First the picture of Tammy, then Brett Clemens, now this? It's scary.

question: Let me tell you "scary," Amber. Look at me. Do you wanna look like you been rode hard and put away wet at my age? I'm a "lifer" here. Best I can hope for is to end up in a descent "raisin ranch" where they'll change me twice a day.
answer: That's it, I'm goin'...

question: Honest to God, if I got to do it over? I'd start walkin' outta this town the minute I took my first step. Practically the only thing I wouldn't do different is have you...
answer: God I hope that's you and not your concussion talkin'.

question: It's me...I just don't want this to be the thing you'd do over. This pageant's your ticket outta here. I know you can win, Amber.
answer: I love you much.

question: Close up shop! You Amber Atkins?
answer: Yes. Yes I am. Thank you, hello.

question: "Name and spell all the United States in alphabetical order."
answer: Seriously?

question: Ah-yep.
answer: Well, ah...Alabama. A-L-A-B-A-M-A. Alaska. A-L-A-S-K-A. Arizona. A-R-I- West Virginia. W-E-S-T-V-I-R-G-N-I-A. Wisconsin. W-I-S-C-O-N-S-O-N. Wyoming. W-Y-O-M-I-N-G.

question: Don't you get it? I was supposed to go first. I was contestant number one. That light was meant for my head. If Janelle hadn't wanted to change numbers... God, I owe my life to that deaf baby.
answer: That was your mom. She wanted you to have this.

question: Really, Loretta?
answer: You-betcha.

question: My mom wanted me to have this?
answer: Oh, shut up. I thought it might help you get some sleep.

question: Loretta, never have kids.
answer: Well God-love-ya for thinkin' I still could.

question: No, wait. It-it was here before the openin' number...wait. What am I sayin'? I should just ask you, Becky. Where is it?
answer: What?

question: You heard me. Where is it?
answer: If you're gettin' at somethin', you better just say it.

question: I just did.
answer: Well then, you better be willin' to back it up, kcause you're talkin' like crazy.

question: Oh-oh, you bring me some of that snotty attitude, Becky - bring it on.
answer: Well, as my mother says at Sunday dinner, "Come and get it," bitch!

question: Oh, I'll "get it." I'll "get it" all right. I might even take seconds.
answer: If you want seconds, then I'll make sure it's hot enough for ya.

question: ...Yah-it's just gone... I mean, I-I just wanna tap, y'know? I'm not sayin' I'm the best, or that I'd even win, but shouldn't I at least get a chance to compete? I just wanted my Mom to see me dance.
answer: Amber - Amber, c'mere.

question: Please, Mrs. K, I got so much Vaseline on my teeth, I'm gonna be smilin' for a year.
answer: No. Here.

question: Mrs. K--
answer: You're... you're special and... Ah hell, go out there and kick some Leeman ass.

question: Mrs. Clark, why are you doing this to me? Why're you pretendin' you don't know what's goin' on?
answer: Amber, I'm sorry. I really am. But you know the rules. All talent costumes hafta be okay'd by Gladys before the pageant.

question: But, doesn't someone taking your costume so you can't compete, overrule that rule?
answer: Sorry. I-I don't make the rules.

question: This, this... This is bullshit!
answer: Amber Atkins! That is not American Teen Princess language!

question: Good, kcause this isn't an American Teen Princess Pageant - it's, it's Nazi Germany!
answer: Where do they get this stuff...

question: Mrs. Leeman?
answer: Huh?

question: I-I'm wearin' this costume. I'm, uh, I'm gonna do my talent tonight.
answer: Oh really - I don't think so. Uh, Amber, I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but rules state that a costume must be okay'd at least a week in advance. And this... This is why we have the rule. My goodness gracious, I couldn't allow a neckline this low on stage. We have kids in the audience.

question: Oh, Amber...
answer: I-I-I-I-I-, j-uh-j-uh-just wanted to compe-e-e-e-ete.

question: I can't believe this is happenin'. I can't believe she said you couldn't...
answer: "Here," wh-wh-what?

question: Shut up, yous guys. Look, Amber, I'm not gonna win. And let's be honest, a family only needs one "Liza" and you know Peter's got much better legs than me.
answer: Your parents'd kill you.

question: Oh c'mon, I love kem, but you know they only had me kcause Peter needed a kidney.
answer: Lis, I want to, I really do, but... Oh, I can't.

question: Then do it for Peter. Mrs. Leeman used to call him a "skinny little fag" when he'd bag her groceries. He'd pop his Nancy-belt if his old jacket somehow, I don't know, got her back.
answer: Yah?

question: Let's get this straight right now. We wouldn't have been late at all if it wasn't for you.
answer: I want to have the big bag of little donuts.

question: You get nothing, Hank, okay?
answer: I want to get the big bag of little donuts.

question: C'mon, Rebecca, you wanted it. Now get up there. Ride it side-saddle if you have to - like a horse. C'mon, now.
answer: It smells funny. Like gasoline.

question: Oh for chrissakes, everything smells like that in Mexico.
answer: My dress'll reek.

question: Amber, if I die from these fumes, will you be sure to cover the hickies on my neck?
answer: Yeah...

question: And the bite marks on my ears?
answer: Yes...

question: I know it doesn't matter, but on my inner thighs.
answer: Yes, Leslie!

question: Okay, I designed the float, you know. And, what's gonna happen here is that this is going to look like a glistening lake beneath the swan.
answer: Uh, Gladys?

question: What!
answer: We need more bars!

question: This is -- what?
answer: Enid ate a whole pan!

question: Oh my God! My Baby! The swan ate my baby! Ow-ow-ow! Get up, Rebecca! Get outta there! We've gotta go to State! Oh hot! Oh, damn. I like this blouse. Rebecca! Get up, angel face. Time to go to State! Ow-ow-ow!
answer: Gladys! Stop it!

question: Guess it wasn't a garage sale as much as it was a bake sale. Ah- hahahahahahahaha!
answer: So help me, Gladys.

question: Becky was my only shot at state!
answer: That's enough!

question: What is wrong with you?
answer: I don't know. I just didn't wanna win like this.

question: You stop right there. You are a good person. Good things happen to good people.
answer: Really?

question: No. It's pure bullshit, sweetie. You're lucky as hell, so you might as well enjoy it. Let's get you a root beer float.
answer: Okay.

question: Do you guys want some shots? I'm buyin'.
answer: I never liked her, but she didn't deserve to die in the belly of a swan like that. The whole thing's just kinda sad and lame at the same time.

question: This came for you, sweetie.
answer: Ah! It's from State! Oh my God!

question: What? For chrissakes, spit it out.
answer: I'll be stayin' overnight at... The Airport Howard Johnsons!

question: Right by the airport - Oh, Amber...
answer: There's an indoor swimming pool! Ahhhh!

question: All right, say "Airport Ho-Jo."
answer: Airport Ho-Jo!

question: I got it! Yeah, why don't ya take a
answer: Loretta, don't do that.

question: I'm sorry. They're just starin'.
answer: I gotta work with these women.

question: Funny, you don't look dead.
answer: Okay ladies, listen up. I'm Colleen Douglas and this raving beauty on my right --

question: I'm a mirror.
answer: Correction. This spunky monkey on my right is Terry Macey. And we are your Minnesota American Teen Princess State Board.

question: We're also the co-founders of the Minnesota Modeling Academy. Applications are at the tiki bar. We'll wave the fifty dollar application fee if you list a friend and put her address.
answer: That's right.

question: Okay?
answer: Mm-hm.

question: Okay, okay, that's enough - I get it.
answer: Well, you're gonna have to do somethin' with those nerves before Nationals. Thirty-million people aren't gonna wait while you run to the john. People, people - wait, wait a minute, here. Uh, while we haven't ruled out sabotage from neighboring state pageants - Iowa, Wisconsin, North Dakota...

question: Yeah.
answer: Dakota.

question: Ohio...
answer: That bitch from...

question: What?
answer: Wisconsin.

question: All right, then.
answer: The bitch.

question: The important thing is that we have a winner...
answer: And, on behalf of the Minnesota Modeling Academy, we proudly present Amber Atkins. Your new Minnesota American Teen Princess.
